properties.name: University of Nebraska Lincoln’s Holland Computing Center
properties.hardwaremetadata: Hosts 32 machines with 64 AMD EPYC cores (AMD 7513), 1.6TB of NVMe, and 256 GB RAM each. One machine has 4 A100 GPUs, 1.6TB of NVMe, and 512 GB RAM.

properties.name: Syracuse University Research Computing group
properties.hardwaremetadata: Hosts 32 machines with 64 AMD EPYC cores (AMD 7513), 1.6TB of NVMe, and 256 GB RAM each. One machine will have 4 A100 GPUs, 1.6TB of NVMe, and 512 GB RAM.

properties.name: Florida International University AMPATH network
properties.hardwaremetadata: Hosts PATh equipment in their Miami interchange point. This consists of 4 machines with 64 AMD EPYC cores (AMD 7513), 1.6TB of NVMe, and 256 GB RAM each. One machine has 4 A100 GPUs, 1.6TB of NVMe, and 512 GB RAM.
properties.address: 11110 S.w. 11th St Rm VH166, Miami, Florida, 33199, United States

properties.name: San Diego Supercomputing Center (SDSC)
properties.hardwaremetadata: An additional 2 racks were added to the Expanse resource, usable via the PATh credit accounts. Each rack holds 16 A100 devices not part of the original Expanse design.

properties.name: University of Wisconsin-Madison’s Center for High Throughput Computing
properties.hardwaremetadata: Served as a staging ground for the resources destined for Lincoln, Syracuse, and Miami. Four machines are kept at Madison, primarily for debugging and testing purposes.

properties.name: Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC)
properties.hardwaremetadata: PATh has received a large allocation in the recently-upgraded Stampede2 resource; this allocation is reachable via PATh computing credits. Stampede2’s new resources include 224 dual-socket Intel Xeon Platinum 8380 CPUs, 10,000 NVIDIA A100 GPUs, and 400 TB of high-speed DDR4 memory.
